verses.text: And when Balaam saw that it pleased the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* to bless Israel , he went not, as at other times , to seek for enchantments , but he set his face toward the wilderness.\f + \fr 24.1 \ft to seek…: Heb. to the meeting of\f*
And Balaam lifted up his eyes , and he saw Israel abiding \add in his tents\add* according to their tribes ; and the spirit of God came upon him.
And he took up his parable , and said , Balaam the son of Beor hath said , and the man whose eyes are open hath said :\f + \fr 24.3 \ft whose…: Heb. who had his eyes shut, but now opened\f*
He hath said , which heard the words of God , which saw the vision of the Almighty , falling \add into a trance\add*, but having his eyes open :
How goodly are thy tents , O Jacob , \add and\add* thy tabernacles , O Israel !

As the valleys are they spread forth , as gardens by the river’s side , as the trees of lign aloes which the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath planted , \add and\add* as cedar trees beside the waters.
He shall pour the water out of his buckets , and his seed \add shall be\add* in many waters , and his king shall be higher than Agag , and his kingdom shall be exalted.

God brought him forth out of Egypt ; he hath as it were the strength of an unicorn : he shall eat up the nations his enemies , and shall break their bones , and pierce \add them\add* through with his arrows.
He couched , he lay down as a lion , and as a great lion : who shall stir him up ? Blessed \add is\add* he that blesseth thee, and cursed \add is\add* he that curseth thee. \p

¶ And Balak’s anger was kindled against Balaam , and he smote his hands together : and Balak said unto Balaam , I called thee to curse mine enemies , and, behold, thou hast altogether blessed \add them\add* these three times.
Therefore now flee thou to thy place : I thought to promote thee unto great honour ; but, lo, the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath kept thee back from honour.
And Balaam said unto Balak , Spake I not also to thy messengers which thou sentest unto me, saying ,

If Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold , I cannot go beyond the commandment of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, to do \add either\add* good or bad of mine own mind ; \add but\add* what the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* saith , that will I speak ?
And now, behold, I go unto my people : come \add therefore, and\add* I will advertise thee what this people shall do to thy people in the latter days. \p
¶ And he took up his parable , and said , Balaam the son of Beor hath said , and the man whose eyes are open hath said :
He hath said , which heard the words of God , and knew the knowledge of the most High , \add which\add* saw the vision of the Almighty , falling \add into a trance\add*, but having his eyes open :

I shall see him, but not now: I shall behold him, but not nigh : there shall come a Star out of Jacob , and a Sceptre shall rise out of Israel , and shall smite the corners of Moab , and destroy all the children of Sheth.\f + \fr 24.17 \ft smite…: or, smite through the princes of\f*
And Edom shall be a possession , Seir also shall be a possession for his enemies ; and Israel shall do valiantly.
Out of Jacob shall come he that shall have dominion , and shall destroy him that remaineth of the city. \p

¶ And when he looked on Amalek , he took up his parable , and said , Amalek \add was\add* the first of the nations ; but his latter end \add shall be\add* that he perish for ever.\f + \fr 24.20 \ft the nations: the nations that warred against Israel\f*\f + \fr 24.20 \ft that…: or, even to destruction\f*
And he looked on the Kenites , and took up his parable , and said , Strong is thy dwellingplace , and thou puttest thy nest in a rock.

Nevertheless the Kenite shall be wasted , until Asshur shall carry thee away captive.\f + \fr 24.22 \ft the Kenite: Heb. Kain\f*\f + \fr 24.22 \ft until…: or, how long shall it be ere Asshur carry thee away captive\f*
And he took up his parable , and said , Alas , who shall live when God doeth this!
And ships \add shall come\add* from the coast of Chittim , and shall afflict Asshur , and shall afflict Eber , and he also shall perish for ever.
And Balaam rose up , and went and returned to his place : and Balak also went his way.
